question: Which Indian wildlife biologist has been conferred the George Schaller lifetime award?
explanation: Wildlife biologist Dr. K Ullas Karanth has been conferred the George Schaller Lifetime Award in Wildlife Conservation Science for his contribution to the field of conservation. He is the first recipient of the award instituted by the Wildlife Conservation Society (WCS) of New York in honour of Dr. George Schaller, who is considered one of the greatest wildlife scientists and conservationists globally. Dr.Karanth is the Director of Centre for Wildlife Studies (Bengaluru). His area of research and study focused on the ecology of tigers, sympatric predators and other large mammals, predator-prey population ecology, and mitigation of human-wildlife conflicts.
